title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Nograles wrong on cash-based budget
subtitle: Nograles, said the Philippines needs “practice” and a “transition” phase for the proposed budget system.
author: verafiles.org
vclaim:
Nograles, chair of the House appropriations committee, told reporters Aug. 9 the Philippines needs “practice” and a “transition” phase, and is not ready for the proposed budget system:

Contrary to Nograles’ claim, the Philippines has already been implementing a key feature of the cash-based budget system for two years.

President Rodrigo Duterte in his veto message on the 2017 national budget that publicly-funded projects be obligated by year end. The rule was in the 2018 budget.

A one-year project implementation period is a key feature of a cash-based system, in contrast with a two-year obligations-based system.

The 2018 budget “will still be obligation-based,” the Department of Budget and Management, but added that agencies are recommended to implement “as if it is a cash-based budget.”

Adopting the cash-based system is a “logical progression from limiting the validity of the budget in 2017 and 2018 from two years to just one year,” the DBM .

Budget Secretary Benjamin Diokno in a press release a cash-based system would “speed up the implementation and completion of priority projects of the government.”

Both chambers of Congress suspended budget hearings due to opposition to the cash-based system.

Department of Budget and Management, President Duterte to submit first cash-based budget to Congress .
